intro: Bertya dimerostigma var. genuina, commonly known as the Australian thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are often covered in a fine, white powder. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
